result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:11 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Marian Kathryn Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Marian Kathryn Smith.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Marian Kathryn Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Karl Anderson and Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Raymond asks for sequestration of witnesses.  Court grants. S/T of Detective Todd Shafer NRPD.  Direct by ADA Ellenwood.  Cross by Atty Raymond. Redirect by ADA Ellenwood.  S/T of Investigator Michael O'Keefe for SCSO.  Direct by ADA Ellenwood.  Cross by Atty Raymond. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Raymond states he is going file a request for substitution of judge.  ADA Ellenwood states she just filed victims autopsy report the defense.  Court notes substitution and will have this sent to DCA for review. Adjourned at 2:17 PM. bph
for victim to appear via zoom for PH on 10/26/22. Filed by ADA Ellenwood. arc       Per SRN,  approved.  JA will let DA's Office know
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:32 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Marian Kathryn Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Marian Kathryn Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file and notes time sensitive matter that needs to be addressed.  ADA Ellenwood makes statements regarding the release of deceased body to family. Atty Satorius makes statements. Attorney arguments. Court makes findings and denies states request and asks to have all autopsy reports or photos be given to Defense immediately once received, Atty Satorius to review within one week.  Court would like to reschedule PH, parties to update the court if new date doesn't work.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:45 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:55 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Marian Kathryn Smith not in court- Did not need to appear.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Marian Kathryn Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court schedules matter for tomorrow at request of State. Adjourned at 8:57 AM. bph

for Criminal Complaint. Filed by WEAU 13 news. arc    Emailed copy  on this date. arc

No use or possession of firearms.

Defendant to surrender passport to St. Croix County Clerk of Court upon release.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, family of S.B.L. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:10 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood with DA Karl Anderson Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson appeared on behalf of Defendant for today Defendant Marian Kathryn Smith in court, in custody. DE doesn't currently qualify, but will most likely qualify due to circumstances. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets PH.  gll
